title: Game-Based Collaborative Learning Course for Improving Algorithmic Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding foundational programming concepts and their application to social problem-solving
context.additional_context: Focuses on algorithm design and collaborative experiences using game development tools, with current professionals participating primarily via smartphones.

learning_goals: Learners can solve three or more algorithm design problems using game development tools.
Learners achieve an 80% or higher project completion rate by applying Socially Shared Regulatory Learning (SSRL) strategies in a collaborative learning environment.
Learners demonstrate a 20% or greater improvement in algorithmic thinking ability scores in post-assessment compared to pre-assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
